definition:
Let $G$ be a group action on a set $X$. The action is called if for any
pair $\alpha, \beta \in X$ there exists exactly one $g \in G$ such that
$g \cdot \alpha = \beta$. (For a right group action it is defined
correspondingly.)

A key example of a regular action is the regular representation of a
group, with action given by group multiplication.
